question.title: Clock
question.description:
In this question you are required to create a class called Clock and save it inside Clock.java. A clock should have two digits for hour (00 to 23), two digits for minute (00 to 59), and two digits for second (00 to 59). When a clock runs, the method runs() will be called along with the parameter stating the positive number of seconds has passed. When the clock is printed, it outputs the time in a specific format, e.g.,

16:33:25
06:13:03

You can tune a clock in two ways. The first way is to state the exact hour, minute, and second using the method setTime(). The other way is to tune by another clock (copy the time from the other clock), which is achieved by calling the overloaded method setTime().

In this class, all fields must be private. You should also best encapsulate your class without exposing any unnecessary public methods.
instructions: Implement private fields for hour, minute, and second.
Implement setTime(int hour, int minute, int second) to set the time.
Implement setTime(Clock otherClock) to copy the time from another clock.
Implement runs(int seconds) to simulate the passage of time.
Override toString() to return time in HH:mm:ss format.
Ensure invalid times are handled with the message 'Invalid time'.
